result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Gary Roy Christenson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 99 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes:
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Summit Police Department.
Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.

No contact with the victim unless they consent and consent by his Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not previously done.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Bail applied to fine.  Remainder of fine to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statue.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary Roy Christenson in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing. 

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 99 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling   
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
*No contact with the victim unless they consent and consent by his agent
 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $13.40 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forward to Village of Summit Police Department);
FINE:  $3089 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);
DNA Surcharge: $250 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute);

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

APPLY ANY BAIL THAT IS POSTED ON THIS FILE
Letter adjourning the time on 08/12/2016
Sentencing hearing on August 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary Roy Christenson in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Felony rights given.  Bail is revoked and defendant taken into custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

WCS will notify the Court.
